title: Palaeontology meets art
caption: Palaeontology meets art
desc: Though it looks like a fresco from Ancient Greece, these are the fossilised remains of a fern found in Córdoba, Spain. The fossil dates back to the Carboniferous period, roughly 350 million years ago. This is a compression fossil - where a small amount of the original plant material was retained with the mineral deposits that help form the impression.
